intro: Bupleurum subovatum f. oxyphyllum, commonly known as the oxyphyll form of the subovate bupleurum, is a variant of the Bupleurum genus native to specific regions of Europe. This plant is characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology, featuring elongated, slightly serrated leaves that are often more pronounced in this form. It typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils, thriving in sunny to partially shaded environments. The flowers are small and clustered, usually in umbels, and can range in color from white to pale yellow. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological traits and ecological adaptations.
